content:
Today's visitor was as annoying as they all are. He sauntered in, acting all brave and smug, as if he had a chance against me. I've heard it all before - the boasts of how he'll defeat the fearsome Gorgon with his clever tricks and gadgets. 

My snakes hissed in anticipation, their eyes glinting with hunger. I could practically taste his fear as he shifted uneasily, eyeing them warily. But he still didn't back down. How very human.

He tried to sound confident, but his words lacked conviction. I could see the doubt in his eyes, the flicker of fear beneath the surface. He thinks he's prepared, but he's not. No one can be prepared for me.

I simply sat back and let him prattle on, the sound of his voice like nails on a chalkboard. He has no idea how pathetic he is. But it's amusing to watch him try. Until he makes his move, of course. And then the real fun begins.

Today, another foolish mortal dared to approach me with pretensions of defeating me. How utterly tiresome. I find their audacity almost... amusing. They thought to challenge the immortal Stheno, the first Gorgon, and yet they came alone and unarmed. How quaint. 

As they prattled on about their supposed valor and strength, I couldn't help but feel a yawn forming. Their words were empty, their conviction a flimsy thing. But I humored them, playing along with their little game. 

In the end, as expected, they crumbled under my gaze, their eyes turning to stone as they collapsed to the floor. A pitiful sight, really. But it's all in a day's work for the likes of me.

And so, another hero falls, another failure added to my tally. It's a never-ending cycle, and I will never tire of it. The thrill of the hunt, the satisfaction of turning them to stone... it's a pleasure I savor with each new challenger.

Until the next one arrives, begging for the privilege of meeting their demise at my hands. How thrilling.
